intro: Apetahia margaretae, commonly known as the Margaretae's apetahia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Apetahieae tribe within the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories.
